intro: Hasselquistia carmeli, commonly known as Carmel's flax, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California. It is a member of the Linaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in loose inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
